result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Levell Pole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in amount of $1,000.58 to the victim, plus all other fees, surcharges and assessments including DV surcharge. Bail to apply.  Remainder to be paid during the period of his probation in case 15CF2352.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

15A 030787/reapplied, kept as DOC collect
15A 030771/reversed
Back to Court.

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
Parties are in court for a plea and sentencing hearing.
Received and filed:
Sentencing documents.
On state's motion, count 1 is dismissed and read-in, and the "Repeater" enhancer in count 2 is dismissed outright.
As to count 2 as amended:
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.   Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:  
  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by: Incemmira P.
.
Defendant sentenced to serve 200 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION with work release and child care release. Credit for 136 days time served.
.
COURT ORDERED:
- Defendant to provide DNA sample if one has not already been given; pay DNA surcharge.
- Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $1000.58 to the victim, Incemmira P, plus all other fees, surcharges and assessments, including DV surcharge, bail to apply, remainder to be paid during the period of his probation in case 15CF2352.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
.
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant.
   
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court, defendant Maurice Levell Pole not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting a plea and sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Statements by Incemirra P. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing however, defense counsel just became the attorney of record. Defense requested a status conference. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
for bail modification from the defense received and filed.

Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Violent Contact order. Court allowed victim to have contact with defendant while defendant is in custody. If defendant is release to convert to no in person contact, telephone and electronic only.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Maurice Levell Pole not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Decision. Decision no longer applicable. Defense requests a plea & sentencing date. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 36.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Decision scheduled for 06-19-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

BRANCH PE for BRANCH 23:

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defendant in court for preliminary hearing as to Case# 15CF002352.  Court orders this case adjourned to Branch 23 for decision.
Clerk:  jms
Case spun to Preliminary Hearing Court.
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders.  The court allows for telephone and electronic contact with the children ONLY.
with all conditions reinstated.

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell via telephone.  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Return on Warrant. Defense counsel is ill, unable to appear. Victim addressed the court. On a motion of the state without objection from the defense, the court reinstated bail and all ordered conditions. Case adjourned for a Bail/Bond Hearing with pending matter set for an adjourned preliminary hearing in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on  05/24/2015 at 13:24. Bench warrant in file. Case set for Return on Warrant date 6/4/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 23. ADA notified. SPD office notified, to provide counsel.
CORRECTION: Cash bond ordered forfeited entry of 2/27/2015 reflects corrected information.

CASE SET FOR 8:30 AM, CASE CALLED AT 1:30 PM
Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court previously with defendant Maurice Pole.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant left court and failed to return. State requests a warrant issued and Jury Trial date vacated. Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued and Jury Trial date vacated.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. Court ordered bail forfeited pending restitution and recompense.

15RM006357  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-07-2015

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Daniel Heaney. State's exhibit #1 received into evidence. State rests.  Defense rests. State's exhibit #1 withdrawn.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.   Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Incemirra P. or her children

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
